SharePoint Portal Server search error solved!

Posted by paullaudeman on February 22, 2005

Our development team recently encountered a cryptic “No results are available due to a network failure” error message while developing our new company portal based on Microsoft SharePoint Portal Server 2003 (product link).

The problem, as it turned out, was caused by the deletion of a user profile property called “Work Phone” (of all things!). Thanks to a post I came across by Nikander over on the MSD2D SharePoint site I made the suggested change and the search started working right away.

I’m still puzzled by why this error occurred and why no further diagnostic information was provided (such as errors being logged to the event log, for example) and why something as simple as the deletion of a seemingly unrelated property would prevent the search features from working. Let’s hope that the SharePoint community continues to grow and evolve while we look forward to the next release of SharePoint with, hopefully, an improved administrative experience.

[tags:sharepoint,sharepoint search]

4 Responses to SharePoint Portal Server search error solved!

  1. Mike Pullen says:
    November 1, 2006 at 10:23 am

    We got this error as we moved to deploy BizTalk 2006 Adapter on our SharePoint Portal Server. SPS gives you this error, (along with being unable to add web parts to portal areas), when it is running under .NET 2.0. Remember kiddies SPS doesn’t run under .NET 2.0, if you want to install a biztalk adapter for SharePoint do it on a virtual server. See the following article for details.

    http://www.microsoft.com/belux/msdn/nl/community/columns/jpoelmans/asp20wss.mspx

  2. Kristin says:
    August 23, 2006 at 8:10 am

    Many thanks also from me!
    One day I have worked on the user profiles and the next day the search did not function any more. I have really despaired. I have restarted the index, the server several times – nothing helped, have added the WorkPhone to quality once more and the search runs again perfectly!

    Greeting, Kristin

  3. devetaki says:
    March 14, 2006 at 8:44 am

    Many thanks for this!!! I was really struggling – I couldn’t understand why the search worked on one of our virtual servers but not on the other one. I then realised after reading your post that I had recently deleted some of the profile properties including WorkPhone. I’ve added this back and amazingly it now works!!

    I cannot access the msd2d link as the database is full and it does not allow me to login.
